value.title: Artificial Intelligence, AI21 Labs has Raised $64 Million to Transform the Way People Read and Write
value.excerpt: AI21 Labs announced today the completion of its $64 million series B funding round, bringing the company's valuation to $664 million.

value.title: Apple's self-driving, electric car efforts still remain stalled: Report
value.excerpt: Apple had first revealed its self-driving tech aspirations in 2016 and since then saw autonomous driving systems as a core technology for the future.

value.title: Ford and VW-backed self-driving company shuts down DC operations
value.excerpt: Argo AI, the self-driving company backed by Ford and Volkswagen, is shutting down its Washington, DC operation as part of a broader round of layoffs impacting about 150 people across the company.

value.title: Ford-Backed Driverless Car Startup Lays Off 150 Workers
value.excerpt: Argo AI laid off about 150 workers this week, a belt-tightening measure following years of fast-paced hiring. The layoffs represented about 6% of the company’s more than 2,000-person workforce, a spokesperson said.

value.excerpt: The upcoming Xiaomi vehicle is likely to be autonomous. The lidar sensor seen on the roof of the car is a key component of any self-driving vehicle.

value.title: Xiaomi’s Self-Driving Test Car Spotted with a Lidar Sensor on the Roof
value.excerpt: Apparently, a car blogger who goes by the username Deroy has shared a picture of Xiaomi’s self-driving test car. The car can be seen to have a sleek design with a lidar sensor on the roof.

value.title: Tesla Reportedly Lays Off 200 Autopilot Employees
value.excerpt: In early June, Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly told executives that Tesla needed to cut 10% of its staff, based on a "super bad feeling" about the economy. Now, as Tesla pares back its workforce, new reports are highlighting where some of those cuts are taking place.

value.title: Tesla Fires 200 People Working on Its Unfinished Self-Driving Tech
value.excerpt: Tesla is gutting a part of its Autopilot department, cutting around 200 jobs from its office in San Mateo, California, CNBC reports.
